summary: This document is an email chain from August 11, 2019, forwarding a timeline of events leading to Jeffrey Epstein's death in federal custody. It details his removal from suicide watch, the failure to assign a required cellmate, and the circumstances of his death on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the timeline; details his custody status, removal from suicide watch, and his death by suicide in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York.

events.title: Epstein placed on suicide watch
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was placed on suicide watch and received a medical evaluation.

events.title: Epstein removed from suicide watch
events.description: The Psychology Services Department at MCC-New York removed Epstein from suicide watch after daily interactions, following established procedures. He was returned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) with a requirement to have a cellmate.

events.title: Cellmate removed and not replaced
events.description: Epstein's cellmate was taken to court and released, not returning to the institution. Epstein was in a legal visit with his lawyers until 6:45 p.m. Despite being on a PSYCH Alert requiring a cellmate, no new cellmate was assigned to his cell.

events.title: Failure of required checks and discovery of Epstein
events.description: After midnight, not all required 30-minute checks on Epstein's cell were performed. At approximately 6:33 a.m., staff found him unresponsive in his cell during breakfast service.

events.title: Epstein pronounced dead
events.description: After being found unresponsive, staff began CPR. EMS transported him to a hospital where he was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m.

locations: MCC-New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC-New York
keyFacts: Epstein was removed from suicide watch on July 29, 2019, by the Psychology Services Department at MCC-New York, contrary to public perception he was on watch at his death.
A critical protocol failure occurred on August 9, 2019: Epstein was on a PSYCH Alert requiring a cellmate, but after his original cellmate was released by the court, no new cellmate was assigned.
The timeline states that after midnight on August 10, 2019, 'not all of the checks required to be performed were actually done,' indicating a failure in inmate monitoring procedures.
Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at approximately 6:33 a.m. on August 10, 2019, and was pronounced dead at a hospital at 7:36 a.m. the same day.

The document is an internal email from the Office of the Attorney General (OAG) seeking verification of the timeline's accuracy before potential public release, indicating official scrutiny of the events.
